1.description: Frontal carinae curving outwards to merge with rugae, which surround antennal sockets (Plate IX: 11); antennal scape weakly curved at base, without angle or carina (Plate IX: 1)

Frontal carinae not curving outwards, projecting beyond the upper level of eyes; antennal sockets not surrounded by rugae (Plate IX: 13, 14) or if so, rugae join frontal carinae near upper third of lengths of carinae (Plate IX: 12); antennal scape angulate, with carina or lobe, or at least much strongly curved at base (Plate IX: 2-10)

2.description: Petiolar node with rounded dorsum; nodes of petiole and postpetiole smooth or only with fine sculpture, not coarsely rugulose; propodeal spines short (Plate IX: 15)
Petiolar node with distinctly flattened dorsum; nodes of petiole and postpetiole coarsely rugulose; propodeal spines long (Plate IX: 16)

3.description: Antennal scape at base angulate, with vertical lobe or dent (Plate IX: 2). Antennal sockets surrounded by rugae, which join frontal carinae near upper third of their length
Antennal scape at base of different shape, but never with vertical lobe or dent (Plate IX: 3-10)

4.description: Petiole with very short peduncle, its frontal surface steep, slightly concave and meets with dorsal surface at right or even acute angle (Plate IX: 17)
Petiole with well developed peduncle, its frontal surface not steep, distinctly concave and meets with dorsal surface at blunt angle (Plate IX: 18)

5.description: Antennal sockets surrounded by rugae, which join frontal carinae near upper third of length of carinae (Plate IX: 12); antennal scape at base strongly curved, but not angulate and without horizontal carina or lobe (Plate IX: 3); alitrunk, petiolar and postpetiolar nodes with very coarse longitudinal rugae; petiole without distinct peduncle, its frontal surface straight and steep, meets with dorsal surface at right angle (Plate IX: 19)
Antennal sockets not surrounded by rugae (Plate IX: 13, 14); antennal scape at base curved, without angle, or angulate, with horizontal carina or lobe (Plate IX: 4-10)

6.description: Postpetiole very broad, wider than length, PPI>0.56 (Plate IX: 20); whole body with very abundant, long standing hairs
Postpetiole not broad, its width subequal to length, PPI<0.50 (Plate IX: 21); standing hairs on body less abundant

7.description: Antennal scape at base curved, without horizontal lobe or carina, at most slightly angulate (Plate IX: 4,5)
Antennal scape at base distinctly angulate, with horizontal carina or lobe (Plate IX: 6-10)

8.description: Antennal scape at base bent in ideal curve (Plate IX: 4); head longitudinally rugulose, reticulate sculpture present only between occiput and eyes (Plate IX: 13)
Antennal scape at base more sharply curved and slightly angulate (Plate IX: 5); frons and genae longitudinally rugulose, upper third of head with reticulate sculpture (Plate IX: 14)

9.description: Antennal scape at base with weak carina (Plate IX: 6); frontal lobes slightly curved, frons wider: FLI 1.10-1.45, FI 2.14-2.30
Antennal scape at base with lobe at least with distinct carina (Plate IX: 7-10); frontal lobes strongly curved, frons narrower: FLI 1.18-1.8, FI 2.60-3.50

10.description: Antennal scape at base with large, often very massive lobe (Plate IX: 7, 8); frontal lobes more strongly curved, frons narrower: FLI 1.59-1.86, FI 3.04-3.50
Antennal scape at base with much smaller lobe or sometimes only with carina (Plate IX: 9, 10); frontal lobes less strongly curved, frons wider: FLI 1.18-1.68, FI 2.60-3.21

11.description: Antennal scape at base with very large, massive lobe (SWI 4.92-6.00) (Plate IX: 7) clearly raised at scape level (SHI 2.77-3.41) (to be viewed in profile, Platc IX: 7a)
Antennal scape at base with smaller and not massive lobe (SWI 6.00-8.28) (Plate IX: 8) not raised at scape level (SHI 3.50-4.57) (to be viewed in profile, Plate IX: 8a)

12.description: Petiole with distinct, sharp horizontal dorsal plate; its posterior face abruptly falls to postpetiole (Plate IX: 22). Antennal scape at base with wider lobe (Plate IX: 9)
Petiole without distinct horizontal dorsal plate; its posterior face smoothly falls to postpetiole (Plate IX: 23); antennal scape at base with narrow lobe or even carina (Plate IX: 10)
